<h2>Distinguishing Features</h2>

A rare species of high altitudes and elevations, G. revolutum is variably red along its relatively wide (1-2 mm) and long (up to 5 mm) prostrate shoots of loosely overlapping leaves. The leaves are made up of two equal and rounded lobes, but along their sides that are &quot;revolute&quot;-- they curl downwards (see photo). There are no oil bodies in the fresh leaves when inspected under the microscope.

See table

<h2>Habitat</h2>

Moist to wet humus, cliffs, rock outcrops, seepage sites, heath, and tundra in the subalpine and alpine zones
